greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = least nonnegative integer such that n appears a(n) times.
comment: The concatenation of the first four terms' (decimal) digits gives 1210 = A046043(1).
example: Note that we do not need to specify a(0) explicitly. Indeed, a(0) = 1 as it cannot be 0. a(1) = 2 as it cannot be 0 or 1.
results.author: _Rick L. Shepherd_, Jun 20 2005
